action.name: This President Is Not Above The Law

name: Investigator Odo
flavor: Odo was pressed into service by the Cardassians during the Occupation of Bajor.

name: Constable Odo
flavor: Chief of Security on Deep Space Nine, Odo was a constant presence onboard the station.

name: Trader Odo
flavor: Disguised as a trader, Odo joined the Defiant crew in preventing the assassination of Captain Kirk by a time-traveling Klingon.

name: Umpire Odo
flavor: As an impartial observer, Odo was asked to be the umpire for a baseball game between the Niners and the Logicians.

name: Stranded Odo
flavor: Stranded after a runabout crash, Odo and Quark were forced to cooperate to survive.

name: Miranda Jones
flavor: Having studied on Vulcan for many years, Dr. Miranda Jones gained control of her telepathic abilities. Born blind she is immune to the affects of the Medusans, whose ambassador she accompanies aboard the Enterprise.

action.name: Violent Emotion is a Kind of Insanity

name: Martia
flavor: A Chameloid prisoner of Rura Penthe, Martia attempted to sabotage Kirk and McCoy's escape in exchange for a pardon.

name: Captain Klaa
flavor: Eager to gain fame by defeating Kirk, Captain Klaa engaged the Enterprise-A at Nimbus III.

name: Subcommander T'Rul
flavor: As part of a Federation-Romulan treaty, T'Rul was posted to the Defiant to operate the cloaking device.

name: Ensign Ro
flavor: A headstrong and proud Bajoran, Ro Laren assisted Captain Picard and his crew in tracking down a group of terrorists.

name: Maquis Ro Laren
flavor: Sent to infiltrate a Maquis cell, Ro Laren instead joined the fight against the Cardassians.

name: Shinzon
flavor: A clone of Jean-Luc Picard, Shinzon captained the mighty Scimitar warship against the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.

name: Will Riker
flavor: First Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, William Riker went on to have a storied career in Starfleet.

name: Lt. Thomas Riker
flavor: Split from William Riker in a transporter accident, Thomas Riker was stranded alone for eight years.

name: Commander Riker
flavor: When off-duty, Commander Riker often held poker nights for his fellow bridge officers.

name: Admiral Riker
flavor: Originally from Q's final test of Picard, Admiral Riker used the Enterprise-D to seal an anti-time rift.

name: Mintakan Riker
flavor: On a mission to gauge cultural contamination on Mintaka, Riker presented himself as a Mintakan trader.

name: Captain Morgan Bateson
flavor: Captain of the U.S.S. Bozeman, Morgan Bateson was stuck in a temporal loop for nearly 80 years.

name: Edith Keeler
flavor: Edith administered a New York mission, near where Kirk was forced to allow her to die in traffic to preserve his timeline.

name: Ensign Tuvok
flavor: Ensign on the U.S.S. Excelsior under Captain Sulu, Ensign Tuvok was present for the rescue of James Kirk and Leonard McCoy.

name: Security Chief Tuvok
flavor: Security Chief for Captain Janeway, and former infiltrator of the Maquis ship Val Jean.

name: Maquis Tuvok
flavor: On a mission from Starfleet to infiltrate the Maquis, Tuvok joined Chakotay's ship and cell.

name: Mirror Intendant Kira
flavor: Intendant of the Bajor Sector for the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance, Kira was captured by the Terran Rebellion.

name: Disguised Kira
flavor: Disguised as a Bajoran prisoner, Kira snuck into a Cardassian camp to rescue Resistance leader Li Nalas.

name: Cardassian Kira
flavor: Kira was kidnapped and modified by the Obsidian Order in a plot to reveal the dissident Tekeny Ghemor.

name: Niners Kira Nerys
flavor: Kira joined Sisko's baseball team, playing shortstop for the Niners against the Vulcan Logicians.

name: Anastasia Komananov
flavor: After a transporter accident, Kira's image is used by a holosuite program to display a Soviet secret agent.

name: Commander Kira Nerys
flavor: To facilitate contact with the Cardassian rebels, Kira was given a Starfleet field commission.

name: Security Chief Worf
flavor: Security Chief for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, he was the first Klingon to graduate from Starfleet Academy.

name: Defiant Commander Worf
flavor: Commander of the U.S.S. Defiant, a warship that saw action against the Dominion and Borg.

name: Civil War Worf
flavor: Called to defend the Empire in the civil war, Worf set aside his Starfleet commission to fight for Gowron.

name: Mirror Regent Worf
flavor: The brutal Regent of the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance in a mirror universe.

name: Will Scarlett
flavor: Forced to fill the role of Will Scarlett in Q's Robin Hood scenario, Worf was 'not a merry man'.

name: Duchamps
flavor: After a transporter accident, Worf's image is used by a holosuite program to display Doctor Noah's henchman.

name: Colonel Worf
flavor: A respected advocate, Colonel Worf represented Kirk and McCoy at their murder trial on Qo'noS.

name: Lieutenant Commander Saru
flavor: Chief Science Officer of the U.S.S. Shenzhou.

name: Yeoman Rand
flavor: Assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, Yeoman Rand served faithfully in the Operations division.

name: The Duras Sisters
flavor: The Duras sisters prosecuted a civil war to replace Gowron as Chancellor with their nephew Toral.

name: Kilana
flavor: In command of a squad of Jem'Hadar, Kilana ordered her troops to attack Sisko's crew to rescue a wounded Founder.

name: Persis
flavor: A human augment, Persis developed a strong attachment to Arik Soong, who she viewed as her father.

name: Holodeck 3 Dr. Brahms
flavor: A holographic representation of Enterprise-D warp system designer Doctor Leah Brahms.

action.name: Society Could Use A Little Chaos

name: Telek R'Mor
flavor: Conducting research near a wormhole, Telek R'Mor agreed to carry a message from the stranded U.S.S. Voyager.

name: KDF Gowron
flavor: Gowron, son of M'Rel, was one of the final two challengers to succeed K'Mpec as the Klingon Chancellor.

name: Chancellor Gowron
flavor: Gowron solidified his postion of Klingon Chancellor by defeating the Duras-led faction of a civil war.

name: Third Remata'Klan
flavor: A Third Jem'Hadar, he loyally followed Keevan's orders, even unto his death.

name: T'Mir
flavor: Part of a Vulcan science vessel that crashed on Earth, T'Mir assumed command of the survivors.

name: Pel
flavor: Pel disguised herself as a male and displayed great business acumen to fight the notion that females can't earn profit.

name: Commander Kor
flavor: Kor, son of Rynar, commanded the force occupying Organia. His conflict with Kirk helped establish the Organian peace treaty.

name: Dr. David Marcus
flavor: Son of Admiral Kirk and Doctor Carol Marcus, David died on the Genesis Planet saving Lieutenant Saavik from execution.

name: Commander Tomalak
flavor: A Romulan Commander who confronted the U.S.S. Enterprise-D on several occasions.

action.name: My Paws And Whiskers, I'll Be Late!

name: Ensign Ogawa
flavor: Head nurse of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Alyssa Ogawa was essential to Doctor Crusher's medical staff.

name: Wesley Crusher
flavor: A young member of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D's crew, which he would later join as an Ensign.

name: Ensign Crusher
flavor: After passing the Starfleet Entrance Examination, Wesley Crusher was promoted to a full Ensign.

name: Acting Ensign Crusher
flavor: After befriending and assisting The Traveler, Wesley Crusher was field promoted to Acting Ensign.

name: Formal Dress Wesley Crusher
flavor: Wesley returned from his journey with the Traveller and attended the Troi-Riker wedding in 2379.

name: Cadet Wesley Crusher
flavor: Wesley Crusher was a Starfleet cadet for three years before leaving with The Traveler.

name: One
flavor: A fusion of Seven's nanoprobes with the Doctor's mobile emitter, was in effect a 29th century Borg.

name: Wrathful Khan
flavor: Exiled by Kirk to the doomed planet Ceti Alpha V, Khan sought revenge for Admiral Kirk's perceived neglect.

name: Young Khan
flavor: Ruler of a quarter of humanity during the Eugenics Wars, Khan escaped earth on the S.S. Botany Bay.

action.name: Take Her Out For a Spin

name: Tailor Garak
flavor: Garak claims to be 'a simple tailor', but some aboard DS9 believe him to be much more than that.

name: Mirror Garak
flavor: Executive Officer of the mirror Terok Nor, Garak favored brutal discipline to maintain order.

name: Obsidian Order Garak
flavor: Reunited with his mentor Enabran Tain, Garak's first duty was to interrogate a Changeling prisoner: Odo.

name: Garak, Elim Garak
flavor: Curious as to Bashir's activities, Garak breaks into Bashir's secret agent holoprogram and joins him.

action.name: You May Have Just Saved The Entire Alpha Quadrant

name: Bartender Quark
flavor: Owner of Quark's Bar, he is one of the more colorful residents of Deep Space Nine.

name: Klingon Quark
flavor: After a Klingon dies in Quark's bar, his widow Grilka takes Quark to Qo'noS.

action.name: You Can't Climb A Mountain On Crumbs!

name: Richard Castillo
flavor: Helmsman of the Enterprise-C, Castillo assumed command after Captain Garrett was killed.

action.name: Why Talk, When We Can Dance?

name: Writer Jake Sisko
flavor: During the Dominion occupation of Terok Nor, Jake writes articles for the Federation News Service

name: Forra Gegen
flavor: A Voth molecular paleontologist, Gegen learned that the saurian species had originally developed on Earth.

name: Captain John Harriman
flavor: Captain of the Enterpise-B, Harriman's first mission was to rescue El-Aurian refugee ships from the Nexus.

name: Commando Crusher
flavor: As chief medical officer of the Enterprise, Doctor Crusher participated in the Celtris III raid.

name: Mobile Doctor
flavor: Equipped with a 29th Century mobile holoemitter, this EMH was no longer restricted in movement.

name: Emergency Medical Holoprogram Mk.1
flavor: The first version of the EMH program in wide distribution, Voyager's EMH is the only one still in medical use.

name: Lieutenant Arex Na Eth
flavor: Navigator aboard the Enterprise, Arex found himself playing his lute under the influence of a love potion.

action.name: Into The Heart Of The Nova

name: Comm Officer Uhura
flavor: Communications Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise, she would later be promoted to Commander on the U.S.S. Enterprise-A.

name: Commander Uhura
flavor: Commander Uhura served under Captain Spock during the attempted theft of the Genesis Device.

name: Yarnek
flavor: Yarnek forced Enterprise crew into a battle of 'good' vs. 'evil' for the edification of the Excalbian people.

action.name: My People Will Find Your Ship

name: First Maje Culluh
flavor: First Maje of the Kazon-Nistrim, Culluh succeeded in capturing U.S.S. Voyager for a short time.

action.name: It Ain't Over Til It's Over

name: KDF Alexander
flavor: Joined the Rotarran as a member of the Klingon Defense Force, against his father’s wishes.

action.name: You Must Remember We Are With You

name: Commando Shran
flavor: An Andorian from the Imperial Guard, Shran confronted Captain Archer on the monastery of P'Jem.

name: Lt. Sulu
flavor: Science Officer on the U.S.S. Enterprise, he would later rise to the rank of Captain onboard the U.S.S. Excelsior.

name: Fencing Sulu
flavor: Intoxicated by the Psi 2000 polywater, Sulu viewed himself as a musketeer onboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.

name: Captain Sulu
flavor: As captain of the U.S.S. Excelsior, Sulu defended the Khitomer peace talks from assassins.

name: Captain Kurn
flavor: Kurn, son of Mogh, joined the Officer Exchange Program to meet his long-lost brother, Worf.

name: Morn
flavor: A talkative and frequent patron of Quark's Bar, Morn was often found enjoying a drink on his bar stool.

name: Vic Fontaine
flavor: A self-aware hologram, Vic runs the 'Vic's Las Vegas Lounge' holoprogram popular among the DS9 command staff.

action.name: The Best Is Yet To Come
I'll See You In Hell First!

name: Miral Torres
flavor: Miral appeared on the Barge of the Dead to her daughter, B'Elanna, during a near-death vision.

action.name: Do You Know Who I Am?

name: General Martok
flavor: A gifted Klingon fighter, Martok rose to the rank of General and, eventually Chancellor of the Klingon Empire.

name: 23rd Century Martok
flavor: A version of Martok from an alternate universe, born into the Klingon Empire during the twenty-third century.

name: Commander Maddox
flavor: A Starfleet cyberneticist, Bruce Maddox attempted to disassemble Data for study.

name: Captain Pike
flavor: Second captain of the Constitution-class Enterprise, Captain Pike is well known for his mission to Talos IV.

action.name: This Isn't The Only Life Available

name: Seven in Blue
flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine—now called Seven—struggled to adapt.

name: Temporal Agent Seven
flavor: A crew member on the timeship Relativity, she was later replaced by Seven of Nine.

name: Seven of Nine
flavor: Despite her past, Seven of Nine proved to be a fearless officer willing to defend the U.S.S. Voyager to the death.

name: Drone Seven of Nine
flavor: When Annika Hansen was assimilated with her family, she became the Borg drone Seven of Nine.

action.name: Hunt It Down And Kill It

name: Indulgent Seven
flavor: In an effort to conceal the Doctor from the Lokirrim, Seven downloads his program into her cybernetic matrix.

action.name: There Won't Be A Next Time

name: Laas
flavor: A Changeling who matured in the Alpha Quadrant, Laas could take a wide range of forms including a warp-capable creature.

name: Lt. Commander Jack Crusher
flavor: Part of the crew of the U.S.S. Stargazer, Lieutenant Commander Crusher was killed in an accident on an away mission.

name: Commander Tucker
flavor: Chief Engineer aboard the NX-01 Enterprise, Tucker remained a hands-on officer unafraid of a little elbow grease.

name: Mirror Tucker
flavor: Chief Engineer of the I.S.S Enterprise, Tucker was able to prevent the U.S.S. Defiant from being lost to sabotage.

name: Counselor Troi
flavor: Ship's counselor on the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, her empathic abilities were invaluable to the crew.

name: Rakal Troi
flavor: Disguised as Major Rakal of the Tal Shiar, Troi was tasked with helping Romulans defect to the Federation.

name: Commander Troi
flavor: Stranded on Earth in the 21st century, Troi helped convince Cochrane to take his historic flight.

name: Bridge Officer Troi
flavor: Troi received a promotion to a full commander after passing the Bridge Officer's Test.

name: Goddess of Empathy Troi
flavor: Ship's counselor Deanna Troi was envisioned as the Goddess of Empathy in a holodeck program of Reginald Barclay's.

name: Durango Troi
flavor: A fan of the 'Ancient West' since childhood, Deanna played the role of Durango in the Deadwood holoprogram.

name: Vedek Winn Adami
flavor: An outspoken member of the Vedek Assembly, Winn was a prominent member of the Bajoran theology.

name: Rogue Kai Winn
flavor: Embittered by feeling overshadowed by the Emissary, Kai Winn turned to the forbidden Kosst Amojen and Pah-Wraiths.

name: Subcommander T'Pol
flavor: Assigned to the Enterprise in the 22nd century, T'Pol was essential to many of the Enterprise's missions.

name: Commander T'Pol
flavor: Promoted to the rank of Commander after joining Starfleet in 2154.

name: Mirror T'Pol
flavor: A Vulcan slave of the Terran Empire, T'Pol joins with other nonhumans in a revolt.

name: Captain T'Pol
flavor: When Archer was infected by temporal parasites, T'Pol took command of the Enterprise.

name: Sybok
flavor: A Vulcan iconoclast, Sybok embraced emotion and sought to find the paradise planet of Sha Ka Ree.

name: Chef Neelix
flavor: Chef and morale booster for the U.S.S. Voyager, Neelix was infamous for his 'even better than coffee' substitute.

name: Commander Kang
flavor: Tricked into a confrontation with Kirk, Kang and his counterpart were forced to work together to defeat their incorporeal manipulator.

name: CMO 'Bones' McCoy
flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Leonard McCoy was a close friend of Captain Kirk.

name: Prisoner 'Bones' McCoy
flavor: Sentenced to a life of hard labor on the asteroid Rura Penthe, McCoy was rescued by Kirk and Spock.

name: "Dark Ages" McCoy
flavor: McCoy infiltrated a 1980s San Francisco hospital to rescue a gravely-wounded Chekov.

name: Drafted McCoy
flavor: Having already retired from Starfleet, Doctor McCoy was incensed to be called up during the V'ger crisis.

action.name: You Don't Trust Me, Do You?

name: Marla McGivers
flavor: Enterprise ship's historian, Marla assisted Khan's coup and followed him into exile on Ceti Alpha V.

name: Cyrus Redblock
flavor: A holographic gangster, this Dixon Hill villain held Starfleet participants hostage during a Holodeck malfunction.

name: Kai Opaka
flavor: Spiritual leader of the Bajoran people during the Occupation, Opaka was the first to recognize Sisko as Emissary.

name: Torchbearer Rejac
flavor: Guardian of the Beacon of Kahless.

name: Interfaced Barclay
flavor: Enhanced by the Cytherians, Barclay created a neural interface to the Enterprise computer.

name: 1701 Sisko
flavor: Sisko, disguised as a crewman of the original U.S.S. Enterprise, worked to prevent the assassination of Captain Kirk.

name: Mirror Sisko
flavor: A privateer who served Intendant Kira Nerys in the mirror universe, he later led the Terran Rebellion against the KCA.

name: Captain Sisko
flavor: Sisko had the heavy responsibility of leading Deep Space Nine through the Dominion War.

name: Promoted Sisko
flavor: Promoted to Captain, Benjamin Sisko was recognized for his accomplishments as Commander of Deep Space Nine.

name: Dr. Hippocrates Noah
flavor: After a transporter accident, Sisko's image is used by a holosuite program to display supervillain Hippocrates Noah.

action.name: The Moment I Made The Decision
I Can Take Care Of Myself

name: Tuvix
flavor: Created in a transporter accident, Tuvix was ultimately separated back into Tuvok and Neelix.

action.name: At the Tip of My Blade

name: GI Chakotay
flavor: While Voyager was under the control of the Hirogen, Chakotay was made to play the role of an Army captain.

name: Doctor Chaotica
flavor: Villain of the Captain Proton holonovel, Doctor Chaotica once waged war against photonic lifeforms from subspace.

name: Rogue Harry Kim
flavor: Fifteen years after losing Voyager in an attempt to get home, Harry resolved to alter the past to save the ship.

name: Arachnia Janeway
flavor: Queen of the Spider People in the 'Captain Proton' holonovels, Janeway assumed her role to defeat Doctor Chaotica.

name: Admiral Janeway
flavor: Within two years of successfully returning home from the Delta Quadrant, Janeway was promoted to the rank of Vice Admiral.

name: Assimilated Janeway
flavor: Captain Janeway allowed herself to be partially assimilated to deliver a nanovirus to the Borg.

action.name: I Don't Respond Well To Threats

name: Grilka
flavor: Grilka, head of the House of Grilka, married Quark in a gambit to keep her house upon the death of her husband.

name: Dr. Tolian Soran
flavor: A survivor of the Borg destruction of El-Auria, Soran was obsessed with returning to the Nexus.

action.name: It Will Pass. You'll See. It Will Pass.

name: Borg Queen
flavor: Originally a member of Borg-designated Species 125, the Borg Queen brought order to the chaos of the hive mind.

name: Grand Nagus Zek
flavor: As Grand Nagus of the Ferengi, Zek was the head of the Ferengi government.

name: Commander Spock
flavor: First Officer onboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, Lieutenant Commander Spock would become a revered member of the Federation.

name: Recovering Spock
flavor: Recovering on Vulcan, Commander Spock spent much time retraining his logical mind.

name: Mirror Spock
flavor: First Officer of the I.S.S Enterprise, Spock was a ruthless officer in the mirror universe's Terran Empire.

name: Ambassador Spock
flavor: Ambassador Spock abuptly vanished, but appeared on Romulus assisting a Romulan-Vulcan reunification movement.

name: Kal-if-fee Spock
flavor: As a combatant in the traditional kal-if-fee contest, Spock is forced to fight Kirk to the death.

name: Talos IV Spock
flavor: Prior to serving with Captain Kirk, Spock accompanied Captain Pike on an away mission to Talos IV.

name: Laborer Spock
flavor: Constructed a mnemonic memory circuit using 'stone knives and bearskins.'

action.name: Logic Is The Beginning Of Wisdom
I Am Well Able To Defeat You
Let Us See What The Future Holds

name: Admiral Nechayev
flavor: Vice Admiral Nechayev commanded Starfleet operations in the vicinity of the Cardassian Union.

action.name: Somehow I thought You'd Be Taller

name: Dr Phlox
flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise, Phlox was a lifelong learner of every medical art.

name: Mirror Phlox
flavor: A sadistic doctor serving on board the I.S.S Enterprise, a starship from the mirror universe.

action.name: I'm A Physician, Not An Engineer!

name: Armed Philippa Georgiou
flavor: Captain Georgiou to excavate a Crepusculan well that had gone dry and save the species from drought.

action.name: I Thought We Had An Agreement
You Are Starting To Annoy Me

name: Captain Kasidy Yates
flavor: Captain of the civilian freighter 'Xhosa', Kasidy was briefly imprisoned for smuggling Maquis cargo.

name: Smuggler Kasidy Yates
flavor: Sympathetic to the Maquis, Kasidy helped Michael Eddington smuggle replicators away from the Cardassians.

action.name: Let's See If You Can Beat That

name: Expedition Vash
flavor: A student of archaeology infamous for her ethically questionable practices.

name: Ensign Mendon
flavor: A Benzite, Mendon was instrumental in stopping a subatomic bacteria from destroying the Enterprise.

name: Cadet Sito Jaxa
flavor: While member of Nova Squadron, Sito Jaxa survived a flying accident that killed one of her fellow cadets.

name: Admiral Cartwright
flavor: A Starfleet admiral, Cartwright was a conspirator in the plot to sabotage the Klingon-Federation peace summit.

name: Botanist Keiko
flavor: A botanist and head of the Enterprise plant biology lab, Keiko later opened a school on Deep Space 9.

name: Hugh
flavor: Survivor of a Borg scout cube crash, Third of Five developed the spark of individuality and became Hugh.

action.name: A Poker Face Carved In Marble

name: Glinn Damar
flavor: First seen aboard the freighter Groumall, Damar served as Dukat's second-in-command across multiple assignments.

name: Revolutionary Damar
flavor: Leader of the Cardassian revolution against the Dominion, Damar was killed by Jem'hadar shortly before the final assault.

name: Commander Nevesa
flavor: Commander of a Romulan vessel, Nevesa was captured by the Enterprise crew while trying to prevent Spock's escape from her ship.

action.name: Look Down Every Now And Then

name: Ensign Vorik
flavor: An engineering officer aboard Voyager, Vorik was part of the team that developed the Delta Flyer.

name: Ensign Seska
flavor: Serving on the Val Jean as a Maquis, Seska was later revealed to be a Cardassian operative disguised as a Bajoran.

name: Kazon Seska
flavor: After leaving Voyager, Seska later joined the Kazon as consort to First Maje Culluh.

name: Chief Engineer Torres
flavor: A half-Klingon Maquis officer who later joined the U.S.S. Voyager as Chief Engineer.

name: Maquis Takeover Torres
flavor: Torres, under the control of Teero Anaydis, helped lead a Maquis revolt on the U.S.S. Voyager.

action.name: Brute Force Isn't Going To Do It
You Know How Much I Hate To Lose
I'm Going To Get This One

name: Section 31 Reed
flavor: Pushed into serving Section 31, Malcolm Reed investigated a secret Klingon program.

name: Tourist Reed
flavor: Looking for some company on the pleasure planet of Risa, Malcolm Reed ends up in a desperate situation.

action.name: Follow Two Aliens into a Basement

name: Abraham Lincoln
flavor: A simulacrum of the late President, created by the Excalbians to examine the difference between good and evil.

name: Gul Madred
flavor: A Cardassian interrogator, Gul Madred was tasked with collecting the defensve plans for Minos Korva from Capt. Picard.

action.name: That Which Is Imperfect Must Be Sterilized

name: Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien
flavor: Leader of the Terran Rebellion, 'Smiley' O'Brien commanded the ISS Defiant against the KCA.

name: Chief O'Brien
flavor: Older and wiser, Miles O'Brien would go on to finish his career as a Professor of Engineering.

name: Undercover O'Brien
flavor: Working undercover for Starfleet Intelligence, O'Brien was ordered to investigate the Orion Syndicate.

name: RAF Miles O'Brien
flavor: O'Brien and Bashir often enjoyed a holorecreation of the Battle of Britain campaign.

name: Falcon O'Brien
flavor: After a transporter accident, O'brien's image is used by Dr. Bashir's holosuite program to display an assassin.

name: Keevan
flavor: Survivor of a ship crash, Keevan ordered his Jem'Hadar to their deaths and then surrendered to Captain Sisko.

action.name: I Did What I Had To

name: Technician Rom
flavor: Younger brother of Quark, Rom found success in Deep Space Nine's Engineering crew.

name: Grand Nagus Rom
flavor: Leading reform among the Ferengi, Rom was eventually elevated to the rank of Grand Nagus.

name: Niners Rom
flavor: Rom joined Sisko's baseball team, pinch hitting for the Niners against the Vulcan Logicians.

name: Berlinghoff Rasmussen
flavor: A 22nd Century 'inventor', Rasmussen posed as a historian from the future to steal from the Enterprise-D.

name: Koloth
flavor: Commander of the Klingon vessel I.K.S Gr'oth, Koloth encountered Kirk at Deep Space Station K7.

name: Ardra
flavor: A legendary devil-figure on Ventax II, a con artist impersonated her in order to take control of the planet.

name: Commander Chekov
flavor: In order to recrystalize the HMS Bounty's dilithium crystals, Chekov harvested gamma rays from the Navy carrier U.S.S. Enterprise.

action.name: We're In A Lot Of Trouble

name: Lt. Tasha Yar
flavor: Security Chief of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Later killed in action by an alien lifeform.

name: Warship Yar
flavor: Refugee of an alternate universe in which the Enterprise-C fought daily battles against the Klingon Empire.

name: Aviator Yar
flavor: Inspired by the holodeck adventures of O'Brien and Bashir, Aviator Yar was released in the Second Battle of New York event.

action.name: You Are Fully Functional, Aren't You?

name: Lieutenant Saavik
flavor: A Vulcan officer assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, she proved herself in battle with the U.S.S. Reliant.

name: Nurse Paris
flavor: Flight Controller of the U.S.S. Voyager, he was haunted by his past in the Maquis and on the U.S.S. Exeter.

name: Captain Proton Paris
flavor: Hero from The Adventures of Captain Proton, Tom Paris regularly took on the role in the holodeck.

action.name: For A Moment I Was Everywhere
Is This What You Call Enlightened?

name: Lore
flavor: Doctor Soong's first Android with a functional positronic brain. Gifted with emotions, he was Data's older 'brother.'

name: The One, Lore
flavor: After stealing an emotion chip intended for Data, Lore became the leader of a breakaway Borg ship.

name: Lursa Duras
flavor: The elder of the Duras sisters, Lursa schemed for her family to lead the Klingon Empire.

name: Crewman Tarses
flavor: A Romulan-Human member of Starfleet who was assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise-D.

name: Idrin
flavor: Commander of a Hirogen hunting ship, Idrin captured Tuvok and Seven of Nine.

name: Commander Sela
flavor: Daughter of Tasha Yar and a Romulan officer, Sela worked to destabilize the Federation.

name: Dr. Soong
flavor: A cyberneticist who created the androids Data and Lore, among others.

name: Judge Q
flavor: All-powerful judge and jury, Q placed the Enterprise-D's crew on trial at Farpoint.

name: Human Q
flavor: After being stripped of his powers by the Q Continuum, Q sought refuge on the Enterprise-D.

name: Sheriff of Nottingham Q
flavor: During his Robin Hood simulation, Q played the role of the Sheriff of Nottingham.

name: Stargazer Picard
flavor: Commanding officer of the U.S.S. Stargazer, where he first served as its flight controller.

name: Enterprise-D Picard
flavor: Captain of the legendary U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Captain Picard was key to many of the Federation's successes.

name: Locutus of Borg
flavor: Captured by the Borg, Locutus was the name given to an assimilated Jean-Luc Picard.

name: Enterprise-E Picard
flavor: Crashed on 21st century Earth, Captain Picard found himself up against the implacable Borg Queen.

name: Tommy Gun Dixon
flavor: During the attempted assimilation of the Enterprise-E, Picard dispatched a Borg drone with holographic bullets.

name: Galen
flavor: Picard assumed the role of the smuggler Galen after being captured by raiders searching for a Vulcan psionic weapon.

name: Detective Dixon Hill
flavor: In his spare time, Picard enjoyed participating in the Dixon Hill collection of holonovels."

name: C.O.P. Founder Picard
flavor: Stepping in for the missing Jonathan Archer, Picard helped form the Coalition of Planets. (Second Battle of New York player vote winner!)

name: Smitten Jean-Luc Picard
flavor: Picard played the role of Lwaxana's jealous lover in a ploy to rescue her from Daimon Tog.

name: Ensign Sato
flavor: Comm Officer onboard the Enterprise, Hoshi Sato's experiences led her to create a universal linguacode.

name: Mirror Empress Sato
flavor: After taking over the Defiant in the mirror universe, Sato proclaimed herself Empress of the Terran Empire.

action.name: I Die Not For Myself But For You

name: Chief Engineer La Forge
flavor: Chief Engineer of the Enterprise-D, Geordi La Forge was an important and gifted member of the crew.

name: Lt. Commander La Forge
flavor: After tangling with the Borg, Geordi found himself and the Enterprise-E back in 2063.

name: Captain La Forge
flavor: Captain of the U.S.S. Challenger, Geordi tried to prevent Kim and Chakotay from changing the past to save Voyager.

name: General Chang
flavor: Chief of Staff to Chancellor Gorkon, Chang conspired to bring about a Klingon-Federation war.

name: Phoenix Cochrane
flavor: Developer of the first human warp drive, Zefram Cochrane was the target of a Borg attack in 2063.

name: Lt. Commander Scott
flavor: An ingenious engineer of Scottish descent who never failed to pull Captain Kirk and the U.S.S. Enterprise out of danger.

name: Captain Scott
flavor: Trapped in a transporter buffer for 75 years, Captain Scott was later rescued by the U.S.S. Enterprise-D.

name: Professor Scott
flavor: Posing as 'Professor' Scott, he helped build a tank to transport humpback whales to the 24th century.

name: Weyoun Clone 4
flavor: A Vorta clone who oversaw a Jem'Hadar attack ship. Later killed after eradicating a Jem'Hadar rebellion.

name: Lon Suder
flavor: A Betazoid member of the Maquis, Suder successfully channeled his violent tendencies to help retake Voyager from the Kazon.

name: Ensign Mayweather
flavor: Helmsman of the NX-01 Enterprise, Travis Mayweather would explore new worlds alongside Captain Archer.

name: Boomer Mayweather
flavor: Travis Mayweather was one of the first 'space boomers,' a person born in space.

name: Tuskegee Mayweather
flavor: Inspired by the holodeck adventures of O'Brien and Bashir, Tuskegee Mayweather was released in the Second Battle of New York event.

action.name: If It's Easy What's The Point?

name: Luther Sloan
flavor: An operative in the Section 31 intelligence agency, he frequently sparred with Julian Bashir.

name: Vedek Bareil Antos
flavor: A moderate member of the Vedek Assembly, Bareil stood againt Winn in the election of the new Kai.

name: Ilia Probe
flavor: Originally a crew member of the Enterprise-A, Ilia was destroyed and recreated as a probe by the entity V'Ger.

name: First Goran'Agar
flavor: Survivor of a crash landing, Goran'Agar was found to naturally produce the drug ketracel-white.

name: Mirror Archer
flavor: First Officer of the 22nd century I.S.S Enterprise, Archer stole the U.S.S. Defiant from the Tholians.

action.name: Luck Had Nothing To Do With It

name: Riley Frazier
flavor: Once science officer of the U.S.S. Roosevelt, Riley was assimilated during the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: Dr. Richard Daystrom
flavor: One of Earth's great scientists, Doctor Daystrom developed the M-5 computer to automate starship operations.

name: Changeling Founder
flavor: One of many Founders, this changeling commanded all Dominion activity in the Alpha Quadrant.

action.name: I Wish You Hadn't Done That

name: Crell Moset
flavor: Revived as a simulation named 'Medical Consultant Program Beta One,' Moset was a brilliant and unethical scientist.

name: Commander Kruge
flavor: Skipper of a bird-of-prey, Commander Kruge sought to weaponize the Genesis device for the Klingons.

action.name: All The Time In The World!

name: Dr. Carol Marcus
flavor: Principal scientist on Project Genesis, Doctor Marcus pursued a dream of bringing life from lifelessness.

name: Commander Barak
flavor: Captain of the K'tinga-class I.K.S Amar, Barak and his ship were destroyed by V'ger.

action.name: I Can Fix Stuff With Duct Tape

name: Enabran Tain
flavor: Former head of the Obsidian Order, Enabran Tain organized a sneak attack against the Founder homeworld.

name: Mirror Jennifer Sisko
flavor: A scientist for the KCA, Jennifer was recruited by the Terran Rebellion by prime universe Ben Sisko.

name: Senator Cretak
flavor: Romulan senator and representative on Deep Space 9, Cretak was the victim of a Section 31 plot keep her from power.

action.name: I Am Trying To Save You

name: First Officer Burnham
flavor: A Starfleet commander, Michael Burnham was the first officer of the U.S.S. Shenzhou.

action.name: I'm Not Staying To Make Friends

name: Resistance Shakaar
flavor: A part of the resistance during the Cardassian Occupation, Shakaar was later First Minister of Bajor.

name: Teenager Nog
flavor: Son of Rom and Prinadora, Nog was a waiter for his uncle at Quark's Bar on Deep Space Nine.

name: Cadet Nog
flavor: Nog became the first Ferengi member of Starfleet, and was assigned to DS9 as part of his cadet field studies.

name: CMO Bashir
flavor: Second in his class at Starfleet Medical, Bashir chose to do 'frontier medicine' at Deep Space Nine.

name: Bashir, Julian Bashir
flavor: Bashir played the role of a secret agent in a recreational holosuite program.

name: Changeling Bashir
flavor: A Changeling infiltrator replaced Bashir and attempted to destroy the Bajoran sun.

name: RAF Julian Bashir
flavor: Bashir and O'Brien often enjoyed a holorecreation of the Battle of Britain campaign.

action.name: This Is Where Heroes Are Made

name: Commander Kelby
flavor: An engineering officer aboard the NX-01 Enterprise, Kelby briefly held the position of Chief Engineer.

action.name: We Are A Long Way From Home
This Is An Act Of Mercy

name: Mirror Kirk
flavor: Captain of the Terran Empire's I.S.S Enterprise, Kirk's use of the Tantalus Device allowed him to eliminate rivals.

name: Kal-if-fee Kirk
flavor: Chosen as champion by Spock's betrothed, T'Pring, Kirk is forced to fight his friend to the 'death'.

name: Romulan Kirk
flavor: Kirk masqueraded as a Romulan in order to steal a cloaking device for Starfleet to study.

name: Admiral Kirk
flavor: After the conclusion of his five-year mission, Kirk was promoted to the rank of rear admiral.

name: Rura Penthe Kirk
flavor: Convicted of the murder of Chancellor Gorkon, Kirk was sent to Rura Penthe, the 'Alien's Graveyard'.

action.name: Plans To The McKinley Rocket Base

name: Dr. Reyga
flavor: A brilliant Ferengi scientist, Doctor Reyga invented the metaphasic shield before his death.

name: Lt. Jadzia Dax
flavor: Science Officer of Deep Space 9, Jadzia is the latest in a line of Dax symbiont hosts.

name: 1701 Jadzia Dax
flavor: Transported to the past via the Orb of Time, Jadzia stopped a Klingon attempt on Kirk's life.

name: Sniper Ezri Dax
flavor: Using a modified TR-116 rifle, Ezri Dax fought a sniper's duel with Lieutenant Chu'lak on Deep Space 9.

name: Blood Oath Jadzia Dax
flavor: Honoring an oath made by Curzon, Jadzia avenged the sons of Kang, Koloth, and Kor.

name: Klingon Bride Jadzia
flavor: Jadzia chose traditional Klingon wedding attire for her marriage to Lieutenant Commander Worf.

name: Princess Jadzia
flavor: In an attempt to entertain Major Kira, Jadzia arranged a visit to a Camelot holoprogram.

action.name: It's about time you came back
We Have to Find My Friends

name: Ambassador Sarek
flavor: Ambassador of Vulcan, he was the father of Spock.

action.name: Halt In The Name of Chaotica!

name: Kahless the Unforgettable
flavor: Cloned in labs in the Boreth monastery, Kahless was the rightful heir to the crown of the Klingon Empire.

name: CMO Pulaski
flavor: Chief Medical Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D in 2365, she also served on the U.S.S. Repulse.

name: Groundskeeper Boothby
flavor: Groundskeeper of Starfleet Academy for decades, Boothby's advice was sought by generations of cadets.

action.name: We've Got The Real McCoy Here.
We Take Our Politics Very Seriously

name: Klingon Dukat
flavor: After capturing a Klingon vessel, Dukat and his crew continued the Cardassian war against the Klingons on their own.

name: Dominion Dukat
flavor: As leader of Cardassia, Dukat delivered on his promise to retake Deep Space Nine from the Federation.

name: Pah-wraith Cult Dukat
flavor: Dukat founded the Cult of the Pah-Wraiths on the abandoned Cardassian station Empok Nor.

name: Breen Disguise Dukat
flavor: Breen Disguise Dukat

name: First Maje Haron
flavor: Leader of the Kazon-Relora sect, Haron was killed when Maje Culluh beamed him into space.

name: Gorn Captain
flavor: Leader of the attack on Cestus III, the Gorn captain was made to fight Kirk by the Metrons.

name: Kurak
flavor: An expert in warp field theory, Kurak attended Doctor Reyga's metaphasic shield test aboard the Enterprise-D.

name: Lieutenant Valeris
flavor: Spock's intended successor, Lieutenant Valeris provided Kirk's logs to be used against him at trial.

name: T'Kuvma
flavor: T'Kuvma sought to unify the fractious Klingon Empire against the Federation.

name: Gary Seven
flavor: A Class 1 Supervisor, Gary Seven spent his life on an alien world training for the day he would return to save Earth.

name: Gilora Rejal
flavor: As part of the Cardassian Science Ministry, Gilora Rejal helped design a subspace relay in the Gamma Quadrant.

action.name: It Was Better When We Were Separate

name: Captain Dathon
flavor: Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel.

name: The Professor
flavor: Built by the Enterprise's computer, The Professor was built to be Detective Data's ultimate challenge.

action.name: The Time For Diplomacy Is Past
When Are You Going To Do Something Interesting?
